page.title: 07WINSON SCHOOL
page.content: In l844 a school was built in the N.E. corner of Winson churchyard for the education of children of "the poor inhabitants" of Winson. An area of the churchyard was fenced off for a playground. The school consisted of a porch and one large classroom heated by a stove, with a smaller room behind. It continued in use till the 1920's when the children were transferred to Bibury and taken there daily by horse and cart. It was then used as a vestry by the vicar of Bibury till the late 1940's when it was disposed of to the Diocese of Gloucester for Â£50, after which it gradually fell into disrepair. In 1984 it was sold for Â£13000 to the Society of All Saints, Oxford, who restored and modernised it to make it into a comfortable retreat for their members.
